title.rendered: 10 Most Walkable Neighborhoods in Los Angeles

content.rendered:
When living in LA, walking is without a doubt the best way to get around the city. Aside from the fact that walking is free, it’s also highly convenient, with numerous shops, restaurants, bars, and activities scattered throughout LA.

If you’re a college student or a young professional trying to save money, moving to a walkable area is truly the best way to go. But with so many options in the city, it can be hard to know which to choose. That’s why, in this post, we’ll list the top 10 most walkable neighborhoods in LA based on their Walk Score, access to public transport, and proximity to shops and other amenities. Read on to learn more!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Los Angeles

The 10 Most Walkable Neighborhoods in LA

1. Central Hollywood

When it comes to sightseeing, Central Hollywood is the place to be! As the “Heart of LA,” this neighborhood features tons of notable landmarks, including the famous Hollywood sign. There are also plenty of historic music venues, velvet-roped nightclubs, and eateries within walking distance. Plus, public transport is a great alternative with many bus lines covering Central Hollywood.

2. Koreatown

Koreatown is a walker’s dream! You can shop for Korean groceries during the day and go clubbing at night without needing a car. There are also many apartments around the area if you’re thinking of living in LA! Not to mention the countless restaurants, bars, and speakeasies that are all easily accessible on foot.

Related: Rooms For Rent In Koreatown, LA

3. Westlake

Westlake has a Walk Score of 91 and is a neighborhood filled with history, art, and culture. It’s a dense district with a close-knit community perfect for artists, young professionals, and families. As one of the most walkable areas in LA, Westlake is super convenient to get around with many businesses and restaurants close by.

4. Mid-City West

If you’re after a quiet, family-oriented neighborhood with plenty of cafes, restaurants, and bars, Mid-City West can definitely deliver! It’s ranked as the fourth most walkable neighborhood in LA with a Walk Score of 90. The neighborhood celebrates some special seasonal events and also has a Farmer’s Market in the Fairfax district. You’d never find yourself bored in Mid-City West!

Related: Pros and Cons Of Living in Los Angeles

5. Pico-Union

In Central Los Angeles, Pico-Union has a Walk Score of 90 and is a primarily residential neighborhood. Additionally, Pico-Union has two historical districts featuring elegant 20th-century architecture. So, if you’re into design and you want somewhere walkable, this could be the best neighborhood in LA for you!

6. West Los Angeles

Aside from being one of the most walkable neighborhoods in LA, West LA is also a great place for bikers. With a Walk Score of 90 and Bike Score of 80, getting to and from the area is safe and easy! What’s more, the district is famous for its Japanese restaurants, Korean BBQ restaurants, and karaoke bars.

7. East Hollywood

When living in LA, East Hollywood is a great neighborhood with everything you need! From the lovely Barnsdall Art Park to traditional restaurants, local cafes, and LGBTQ-friendly bars, the area is bustling with activity and culture. You can even visit the LA Municipal Art Gallery for a peek at exhibitions by the artists of Southern California! Plus, East Hollywood has a Walk Score of 89, making it a pedestrian-friendly neighborhood.

8. Palms

Palms is the oldest neighborhood in the city, and it’s also very diverse. There’s a superb apartment community in the area, so that’s a plus if you’re thinking of living in LA! Also, the many restaurants, parks, and even a library and public pool can be easily explored by foot. It’s no wonder Palms is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in LA!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Palms, Los Angeles

9. Rampart Village

If you’re a pet owner, then Rampart Village is the best neighborhood in LA for you! The area has a Walk Score of 89 and has two animal hospitals, a dog café, and even a dog park! Walking around the neighborhood would surely make you (and your pet!) happy.

Related: Pet Fees: The Detailed Costs Of Moving In With Your Furry Best Friend

10. Hollywood Studio District

Being a resident of the Hollywood Studio District means having restaurants and other local conveniences nearby. With a Walk Score of 88, Hollywood Studio District is one of the more walkable areas in LA. You can even check out some famous attractions while you’re in the area, like the Bronson Caves or the Museum of Death.

Related: A Basic Guide On Living With Roommates In LA

So, Where to?

Looking to move to a more walk-friendly area, or just want to save on gas money? Explore the most walkable neighborhood in LA – Central Hollywood! Want somewhere quieter and more residential? Westlake and Mid-City West are also great options.

If you’re a history buff or you’re into art and culture, Pico Union, West Los Angeles, and East Hollywood are ideal! Or, if you’d like to get a pet, you should definitely check out Rampart Village!
